topic.name: Authentication & Authorization
topic.description: Facts about how auth works in this project

facts.question: How does authentication work?
facts.answer: Mock authentication with zustand store. Login validates against hardcoded users, stores user in localStorage via persist middleware.

facts.question: What are the available test users?
facts.answer: admin@example.com / admin123 (admin role), user@example.com / user123 (user role)

facts.question: How are roles structured?
facts.answer: Three roles with hierarchy: guest (0) < user (1) < admin (2). Each role has specific permissions defined in roles config.

facts.question: What guards are available?
facts.answer: AuthGuard (must be logged in), GuestGuard (must NOT be logged in), RoleGuard (requires specific role), PermissionGuard (requires specific permission)

facts.question: How does route protection work?
facts.answer: Routes have meta with access type: public, guest, authenticated, or role. RouteGuard component wraps routes and applies appropriate guard.
